gallery.database.entities

Class Photograph

  • java.lang.Object
    • gallery.database.entities.Photograph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @Entity
public class Photograph
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An entity representing the file containing the image.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        The filename and extension of the photograph.
        Returns:
        String containing the filename, for example "DSCN0034.JPG".

        Parameters:

      • getRelativepath

        public java.lang.String getRelativepath()
        The path to the filename, a relative path based from the Location
        Returns:
        String with the relative path, for example "vacation/2010".
        See Also:
        getLocation()

      • setRelativepath

        public void setRelativepath(java.lang.String relativepath)
        Sets the relative path.
        Parameters:
        relativepath - String, for example "vacation/2010"

      • getTaken

        public java.util.Date getTaken()
        Indicates when the picture was taken. This is, if possible, taken from the information contained in the picture and is usually stored by the device that took the picture. Does not automatically retrieve this from the picture. This is done when the picture is imported.
        Returns:
        the Date, or null if not set.

      • setTaken

        public void setTaken(java.util.Date taken)
        Sets the date at which the picture was taken.
        Parameters:
        taken - the new date when the picture was taken.

      • getLocation

        public Location getLocation()
        Indicates in what location the picture resides (amongst other pictures).
        Returns:
        Location of the picture, contains an absolute path.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Location location)
        Sets the location.
        Parameters:
        location - the new location of this photograph.

      • getTagCollection

        public java.util.Collection<Tag> getTagCollection()
        Returns the tags associated with this picture.
        Returns:
        a collection of tags.

      • getFullPath

        public java.lang.String getFullPath()
        Provides a full absolute file path to this file.
        Returns:
        an absolute path to the file, for example "/home/mrbear/gallery/vacation/2012/DSCN00244.JPG".

      • setTagCollection

        public void setTagCollection(java.util.Collection<Tag> tagCollection)
        Sets the tags collection.
        Parameters:
        tagCollection - a new tags collection.

      • getFilesize

        public java.lang.Long getFilesize()
        Returns the size of the file in bytes.
        Returns:
        Long containing the filesize in bytes.

      • setFilesize

        public void setFilesize(java.lang.Long filesize)
        Sets the filesize of the file in bytes. Only really used when creating a new photograph.
        Parameters:
        filesize - a new filesize.

      • getHashstring

        public java.lang.String getHashstring()
        Returns a hash string representing the file. This makes it easier to compare this file to other files, without having to do a byte-wise compare of file contents. Slight risk of double hashes, but we don't mind.
        Returns:
        String containing a hash.

      • setHashstring

        public void setHashstring(java.lang.String hashstring)
        Sets the hashstring.
        Parameters:
        hashstring - the new hash string.

      • hasNoAngle

        public boolean hasNoAngle()
        Indicates if an angle has been stored in the entity.
        Returns:
        true if no angle is stored.

      • getAngle

        public ImageAngle getAngle()
                    throws com.drew.imaging.ImageProcessingException,
                           java.io.IOException,
                           com.drew.metadata.MetadataException
        Indicates the angle at which the picture was taken. This is, if possible, stored in the information contained in the picture and is usually stored by the device that took the picture. If not set for this picture, will attempt to retrieve it from the metadata.
        Returns:
        an ImageAngle or null if unable to determine.
        Throws:
        com.drew.imaging.ImageProcessingException
        java.io.IOException
        com.drew.metadata.MetadataException

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(ImageAngle angle)
        Sets the angle of the photograph.
        Parameters:
        angle - the new angle, may be null.
